channel.title: Kids Story of the Day
channel.description: One random curated podcast from the great wide web, updated daily.

item.title: [WowInTheWorld] Tour of Titan
item.description:
Mindy stars in her original one-woman production "The Moon and The Submarine"... with some help from Guy Raz, of course! Experience Mindy's out of this world performance and learn about what makes Titan one of Saturn's most special (and SMELLY!) moons.

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: [WowInTheWorld] Another Prehistoric Mystery (3/20/23)
item.description:
What really happened to the ichthyosaurs? Detective Mindy and Junior Detective Dennis are determined to find out! Join Mindy, Guy Raz, and the Wow Crew in the mystery of why prehistoric swimming reptile bones were found in the desert. It's the who, what, when, where, how and WOW of ichthyosaurs!

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: [GirlTales] Lucky Duck
item.description: Lucky is a grey bird in a sea (or lake) of little yellow ducks. When the yellow ducks decide to leave Lucky out of their games and tease her because of her grey feathers, she turns to Rebecca for some love and advice. An adaptation of The Ugly Duckling by Hans Christian Andersen Written by Chad Chenail Performed and Executive Produced by Rebecca Cunningham For the Grownups! Patreon: https://patreon.com/girltales Girl Tales Store: https://girltalespodcast.com/store-2/ Rebecca?s Newsletter: https://girltalespodcast.us16.list-manage.com/subscribe?u=164c30f0c37a086fa0e32bb5b&id=bdacaecddd Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/girltalespodast/ Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/girltales/ Girl Tales Grown-Ups Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/2394948737386136 See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

item.title: [WowInTheWorld] One True Millipede
item.description:
There's a new taco at the Knuckle Hut and everyone is so excited to give it a try! But first, Mindy and Guy have to check out the animal who's up for the World's Genius Book Record for most legs! Who will it be, Gramma G-Force, a spider, or a... millipede?! It's the who, what, when, where, how, and wow of millipedes!

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: [StoriesPod] The Plum Pit Thief
item.description:
Kwan is an old man who doesn't have enough money to buy rice. When he steals some at the market, he gets sent to jail! Now what will he do?

If you would like to support Stories Podcast, you can subscribe and give us a five star review on iTunes, head to patreon.com/stories and pledge to make a monthly donation, or just tell your friends about us! 

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

"

item.title: [Storynory] Katie and the Christmas Chimney
item.description:
We re-release a Storynory Christmas favourite about Katie the Witch.? Katie's school

is looking into Victorian times - including Chimney Sweeps.? How could this relate to?

Katie's Chrismtas?? Find out!?

item.title: [BrainsOn] The mystery of gravity
item.description: Gravity is a very familiar force to us here on Earth. We know how it behaves and how it affects us. But where does it come from? We?ll also talk to a NASA astronaut about what it?s like to experience micro-gravity.

item.title: [StoriesPod] The Very Sick Goblins
item.description:
Louise the doctor is very excited to take a vacation from curing people, but when she gets kidnapped by some very sick goblins she HAS to help them feel better... or they'll make her into soup!


Fun fact: the song in this episode is just the right length to sing while you wash your hands! If you and your family start using it while you wash, take a video and send it to us on Instagram! We're @storiespodcast. We'd also love to see any drawings you and your kids make of the characters from our stories. Tag us in them and we'll repost on our feed! Stay healthy!!


If you would like to support Stories Podcast, you can subscribe and give us a five star review on iTunes, head to patreon.com/stories and pledge to make a monthly donation, check out our merch at storiespodcast.com/shop, or just tell your friends about us! 


Thank you!!

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

"

item.title: [WowInTheWorld] Two Whats?! And A Wow! - Speed Round (3/24/23)
item.description:
Why is Mindy jogging around the studio? And what does it have to do with peregrine falcons? We've got the questions AND answers in today's round of Two Whats?! And A Wow! It's up to you to separate the WOWs from the WHATs about FAST THINGS!

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: [StoriesPod] Stories Podchats: New Games Jamboree
item.description:
Today's episode is another installment of Stories Podchats, join Amanda, Kelsie, and Dan... I mean Wiz Quizzley for 3 new puzzler games.

Draw us a picture of what you think any of the characters in this story look like, and then tag us in it on instagram @storiespodcast! We'd love to see your artwork and share it on our feed!!

If you would like to support Stories Podcast, you can subscribe and give us a five star review on iTunes, check out our merch at storiespodcast.com/shop, follow us on Instagram @storiespodcast, or just tell your friends about us!

Check out our new YouTube channel at youtube.com/storiespodcast. If you've ever wanted to read along with our stories, now you can! These read-along versions of our stories are great for early readers trying to improve their skills or even adults learning English for the first time. Check it out.

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

"

item.title: [GirlTales] Chloe Asks Liza Questions About The Mystery of the Dancing Princesses
item.description: In this episode, Chloe, a kid like you, asks Liza Birkenmeier questions about the story she wrote for Girl Tales called "The Mystery of the Dancing Princesses". Listen to The Mystery of the Dancing Princesses: https://girltalespodcast.com/2018/03/30/the-mystery-of-the-dancing-princesses-by-liza-birkenmeier/Join our Patreon: www.patreon.com/girltalesListen to Chloe's Friendship Circle: http://www.chloesfriendshipcircle.com/ See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

item.title: [WowInTheWorld] Two Whats?! And A Wow! - A What?! By Any Other Name
item.description:
What are fire ants and alligators doing in Mindy's Gingerbread Mansion?! And why is Mindy calling them by the wrong names?! We've got the questions AND answers in this ear-catching round of Two Whats?! And A Wow! We're challenging you to find the facts from the fiction about animal names!

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: [But Why] Why Do We Celebrate Halloween?
item.description: Why do we celebrate Halloween? Who created this holiday? Where do pumpkins come from and why do we carve them? This week we're answering your Halloween questions with a professor of all kinds of scary and creepy things, Regina Hansen of Boston University.

item.title: [What If] Ecco asks: What if Ninjago LEGOs came to life?
item.description: Abacus P. Grumbler gets to host his own cooking show this week, and the whole Jamma-Loo Family will learn the great secrets of cooking magic? That is, if they can keep Zach?s Ninjagoos under control. Lessons: It?s fun to forget ourselves while playing, but we still need to remember our friends? feelings; throwing an egg in its shell is painful! Join our Patreon for Ad-Free stories, a Shout-Out on the show, bonus audio, a better chance of having your question answered, and more! patreon.com/whatifworld Subscribe to What If World wherever you listen: link.chtbl.com/whatifworld. Share questions via Twitter @whatifworldpod, Facebook @whatifworldpodcast, Instagram @whatifworldpodcast, or email whatifworldpodcast@gmail.com What If World is made by Eric O?Keeffe with help from Karen Marshall O'Keeffe. Our theme song is by Craig Martinson and our podcast art is by Jason O?Keefe. Additional songs and sound effects from audioblocks.com. This week?s art was adapted from pieces by OCAL.

item.title: [What If] Liam asks: What if Santa was an elephant?
item.description: Merry Ifmas and Happy Holidays! Scully the Squid has had a tough year and isn?t really sure what he wants, so Santaphant gives him a telepathic toy to help figure it out. Will Scully learn to speak his mind? Lessons include: bottling up your emotions doesn?t gets good results, ?boy? and ?girl? toys have more in common than you think This episode originally aired December 18th, 2017. Join our Patreon for Ad-Free stories, a Shout-Out on the show, bonus audio, a better chance of having your question answered, and more! patreon.com/whatifworld Great merch available at the Imaginarium! Featuring artwork from Ana Stretcu: whatifworld.threadless.com Subscribe to What If World wherever you listen: link.chtbl.com/whatifworld. Kids can share questions with a grownup's help via Twitter @whatifworldpod, Facebook & Instagram @whatifworldpodcast, or email whatifworldpodcast@gmail.com What If World is made by Eric and Karen O'Keeffe. A big thanks to our associate producer Miss Lynn. Our podcast art is by Jason O?Keefe and our theme song is by Craig Martinson. Advertise on What If World

item.title: How do computers store so much info in such a tiny space?
item.description: If you translate ?Hello! How are you?? to binary code, it looks like this: 01001000 01100101 01101100 01101100 01101111 00100001 00100000 01001000 01101111 01110111 00100000 01100001 01110010 01100101 00100000 01111001 01101111 01110101 00111111 This episode takes a look at how computers can do so much with such tiny parts. But computers weren't always small -- so we take a look at where computers came from. We visit Ada Lovelace, whose love of math and weaving paved the way for modern-day computers. And we hear about the material that let computers shrink from the size of a room to something that fits in our pockets. There?s also a visit from a yak and a ram, but you?re just going to have to listen to find out why.All that plus a new Mystery Sound and Moment of Um that answers the question: what is the flavor of root beer?This episode is sponsored by Mathnasium (Mathnasium.com) and Sun Basket (sunbasket.com promo code: brains on)

item.title: How do animals build their homes?
item.description: People are really good at building homes out of everything from wood and concrete to mud and ice. But when it comes to animal homes, creatures can be more inventive than humans!In this creatively constructed episode, Molly and cohost Marama renovate Brains On HQ with the help of some clever critter contractors. They talk to animal experts and navigate demolition disasters to build a delicious new food hall for Brains On. Plus, a super spiffy Mystery Sound!This episode was sponsored by:Indeed (Indeed.com/BRAINS - To claim your SEVENTY FIVE DOLLAR SPONSORED JOB CREDIT to upgrade your job post. Terms and conditions apply.)Paw Patrol Movie (Pawpatrol.movie - Catch PAW PATROL: THE MIGHTY MOVIE in theaters on September 29th!)Factor Meals (Factormeals.com/brainson50 - To get 50% off.)IXL (IXL.COM/FIELDTRIP - To get a 20% off an IXL membership.)Greenlight (Greenlight.com - The banking and investing app for kids and teens.)*****Do you have your Smarty Pass yet?? item.title: Charged up! The science of batteries
item.description: Batteries are everywhere ? they?re in our phones, our computers, our cars, our toys. But how do they work? To find out, we talk to a scientist who?s making really big batteries to store renewable energy, another who?s working on really small ones to power our phones, and we play in a park with a dog.
